    • Method Detail

      • addProject

        public void addProject​(java.lang.String projectName,
                       java.lang.String clientName,
                       java.util.Calendar initialDate,
                       java.util.Calendar endDate,
                       double budget,
                       java.lang.String manager,
                       java.lang.String managerPhone,
                       java.lang.String clientPhone)
        This function adds a new project to the array of projects with the given project details.
        Parameters:
        projectName - A string representing the name of the project.
        clientName - The name of the client for whom the project is being done.
        initialDate - A Calendar object representing the initial date of the project.
        endDate - The end date of the project, represented as a Calendar object.
        budget - The budget parameter is a double data type that represents the total amount of money allocated for the project.
        manager - The name of the manager assigned to the project.
        managerPhone - The phone number of the project manager.
        clientPhone - The client's phone number for the project.

      • getFirstValidPosition

        public int getFirstValidPosition()
        This function returns the index of the first null element in an array of projects.
        Returns:
        The method is returning an integer value, which is the first valid position in an array called "projects". If there are no null values in the array, the method will return -1.

      • initializeStages

        public void initializeStages​(java.lang.String projectName,
                             java.util.Calendar beginDate,
                             java.util.Calendar realBeginDate,
                             int StageMonths)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        This function initializes stages for a project with given start dates and duration.
        Parameters:
        projectName - The name of the project to which the stages will be added.
        beginDate - The start date of the project's first stage.
        realBeginDate - The actual start date of the project, which may differ from the planned start date (beginDate).
        StageMonths - The duration of each stage in months.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addCapsule

        public void addCapsule​(java.lang.String projectName,
                       java.lang.String capsuleId,
                       int type,
                       java.lang.String capsuledescription,
                       java.lang.String nameEmployee,
                       java.lang.String chargeEmployee,
                       java.lang.String lessonLearned)
        This function adds a capsule to a project's active stage based on the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        projectName - The name of the project to which the capsule will be added.
        capsuleId - A unique identifier for the capsule being added.
        type - An integer representing the type of capsule being added.
        capsuledescription - A description of the capsule being added.
        nameEmployee - The name of the employee who created the capsule.
        chargeEmployee - The chargeEmployee parameter is a String that represents the name of the employee who is in charge of the capsule being added.
        lessonLearned - lessonLearned is a String parameter that represents the lesson learned from the capsule being added.

      • approveCapsule

        public java.lang.String approveCapsule​(java.lang.String projectName,
                                       java.lang.String capsuleId,
                                       java.util.Calendar publishDate,
                                       boolean newStatus)
        The function approves or disapproves a capsule in a specific project and stage, and sets the publish date if approved.
        Parameters:
        projectName - A String representing the name of the project to which the capsule belongs.
        capsuleId - A unique identifier for the capsule that needs to be approved or disapproved.
        publishDate - A Calendar object representing the date when the capsule is approved.
        newStatus - A boolean value indicating whether the capsule should be approved or not. If true, the capsule will be approved and its publish date will be set to the provided date. If false, the capsule will remain unapproved.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a String message. The message will either indicate that the capsule has been approved and provide the approval date, or indicate that the capsule remains unapproved.

      • publishCapsule

        public java.lang.String publishCapsule​(java.lang.String projectName,
                                       java.lang.String capsuleId,
                                       boolean newPublishedStatus)
        The function publishes a capsule with a given ID and project name if it is approved and not already published.
        Parameters:
        projectName - A String representing the name of the project to which the capsule belongs.
        capsuleId - A unique identifier for the capsule that needs to be published.
        newPublishedStatus - A boolean value indicating whether the capsule should be published or not. If true, the capsule will be published. If false, it will not be published.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a String message. The content of the message depends on the conditions met during the execution of the method.

      • finishStage

        public java.lang.String finishStage​(java.lang.String projectName,
                                    java.util.Calendar endDate,
                                    int amountMonths)
        This function deactivates the current stage of a project and activates the next stage, while setting the real end date of the current stage.
        Parameters:
        projectName - A String representing the name of the project to finish a stage for.
        endDate - A Calendar object representing the actual end date of the current stage.
        amountMonths - The parameter "amountMonths" is not used in the given code snippet.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a String message indicating that the current stage has been deactivated and the next stage has been activated.

      • checkProject

        public boolean checkProject()
        This function checks if there is at least one project in an array of projects.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value, which indicates whether all the elements in the projects array are not null. If all elements are not null, the method returns true, otherwise, it returns false.

      • showCount1

        public java.lang.String showCount1()
        The function returns a string message displaying the count of different types of capsules.
        Returns:
        The method `showCount1()` returns a string message that displays the count of four different types of capsules: technic, management, domain, and experience. The message includes the count of each type of capsule.

      • showLearnedLessonsByStage

        public java.lang.String showLearnedLessonsByStage​(java.lang.String projectName,
                                                  int positionStage)
        This function returns a string containing the lessons learned for a specific stage of a project.
        Parameters:
        projectName - A String representing the name of the project for which the learned lessons are to be shown.
        positionStage - The position or index of the stage within the project's array of stages.
        Returns:
        The method returns a String containing the lessons learned for all capsules in the specified stage of the specified project, or a message indicating that no capsules or projects have been registered yet.

      • getProjectWithMostUnits

        public java.lang.String getProjectWithMostUnits()
        This function returns a message indicating the project with the highest number of capsules among all registered projects.
        Returns:
        The method returns a String message indicating the project with the most capsules and the number of capsules it has, or a message indicating that no projects are registered yet.

      • getCapsulesByWorker

        public java.lang.String getCapsulesByWorker​(java.lang.String workerName)
        The function returns a message indicating whether a worker has registered a capsule in any of the projects and stages.
        Parameters:
        workerName - A String representing the name of the worker whose capsules need to be searched for.
        Returns:
        The method returns a message indicating whether a worker has registered a capsule or not. The message can be "Yes, the worker: [workerName], has registered a capsule.", "No, the worker has not registered a capsule.", or "No capsule registered yet." depending on the conditions met in the loops. If there is no project registered yet, the message will be "There is no project registered

      • setStartDate

        public void setStartDate​(java.lang.String projectName)
        This function sets the start date of a project stage based on the end date of the previous stage.
        Parameters:
        projectName - A String representing the name of the project for which the start date needs to be set.

      • setEndDate

        public void setEndDate​(java.lang.String projectName,
                       int amountMonths)
        This function sets the end date of an active stage in a project based on the project name and the amount of months to add.
        Parameters:
        projectName - A String representing the name of the project for which the end date needs to be set.
        amountMonths - The number of months to add to the end date of the active stage in the specified project.
